Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for secure remote access to virtual machines, including bandwidth, latency, and redundancy needs. Identify the virtual networks and subnets that will use Azure Bastion.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of Azure Bastion within the virtual network, subnet configuration, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.

Tasks.Task: Create Dedicated Subnet for Azure Bastion
Tasks.Task Description: Create a dedicated subnet named 'AzureBastionSubnet' in the virtual network where Azure Bastion will be deployed. Ensure the subnet meets the required size and IP address range.
Deploy Azure Bastion in the specified virtual network using the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell. Ensure proper configuration during deployment.
Apply Network Security Groups (NSGs) to the Azure Bastion subnet to restrict access and ensure security. Define inbound and outbound rules as per organizational policies.
Enable security features such as Just-in-Time (JIT) VM access and Azure Bastion's native encryption for secure remote access.
Test the connectivity to virtual machines through Azure Bastion to ensure proper functionality and security. Verify that access is restricted to authorized users.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to track Azure Bastion usage, performance, and security events.
Document the Azure Bastion setup, including network architecture, security configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant teams.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Bastion, including best practices for secure remote access.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure Azure Bastion configurations comply with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
